member.name: T:AndanteTribe.IO.MessagePack.MessagePackLocalPrefs
member.summary: MessagePack-based implementation of that provides efficient key-value storage with persistent data on the filesystem. This implementation uses for serialization, which offers high-performance binary serialization with smaller output size compared to JSON. The class maintains an in-memory index of stored data for optimized reading and writing operations, and supports LZ4 compression by default.

member.name: M:AndanteTribe.IO.MessagePack.MessagePackLocalPrefs.#ctor(System.String@,MessagePack.IFormatterResolver)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom serializer options. This constructor loads existing data from the specified file path if available, or initializes a new storage structure if the file doesn't exist. The implementation maintains a header dictionary that maps keys to their position in the data buffer for efficient retrieval and updates. LZ4 block compression is applied by default to reduce storage size.
member.param: The file path where preference data will be stored. The file will be created if it doesn't exist.
Optional custom formatter resolver for serialization. If null, default resolver is used.

member.name: M:AndanteTribe.IO.MessagePack.MessagePackLocalPrefs.#ctor(AndanteTribe.IO.IFileAccessor,MessagePack.IFormatterResolver)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a custom formatter resolver. This constructor provides a convenient way to specify a custom formatter resolver for serialization. The resolver will be applied to the default MessagePack serializer options.
member.param: Optional file system accessor for reading/writing operations. If null, the default implementation is used.
Optional custom formatter resolver for serialization. If null, default resolver is used.

member.name: M:AndanteTribe.IO.MessagePack.MessagePackLocalPrefs.#ctor(System.String@,MessagePack.MessagePackSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom serializer options. This constructor loads existing data from the specified file path if available, or initializes a new storage structure if the file doesn't exist. The implementation maintains a header dictionary that maps keys to their position in the data buffer for efficient retrieval and updates. LZ4 block compression is applied by default to reduce storage size.
member.param: The file path where preference data will be stored. The file will be created if it doesn't exist.
Optional MessagePack serializer options to customize serialization behavior. If null, default options are used with LZ4 compression.

member.name: M:AndanteTribe.IO.MessagePack.MessagePackLocalPrefs.#ctor(AndanteTribe.IO.IFileAccessor,MessagePack.MessagePackSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom serializer options. This constructor loads existing data from the specified file path if available, or initializes a new storage structure if the file doesn't exist. The implementation maintains a header dictionary that maps keys to their position in the data buffer for efficient retrieval and updates. LZ4 block compression is applied by default to reduce storage size.
member.param: Optional file system accessor for reading/writing operations. If null, the default implementation is used.
Optional MessagePack serializer options to customize serialization behavior. If null, default options are used with LZ4 compression.

member.name: T:MessagePack.GeneratedMessagePackResolver
member.summary: A MessagePack resolver that uses generated formatters for types in this assembly.

member.name: F:MessagePack.GeneratedMessagePackResolver.Instance
member.summary: An instance of this resolver that only returns formatters specifically generated for types in this assembly.
